intro: Urtica dioecia, commonly known as stinging nettle, is a biennial plant native to Europe, Asia, and North America. It is characterized by its hollow,螫刺-covered stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant contains a mixture of formic acid and histamine in its stinging hairs, which cause a painful rash upon contact. Urtica dioecia is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in both sunny and shaded environments. It is also known for its nutritional value, containing high levels of vitamins and minerals.
